forecast_udf module

The forecast_udf module contains…

The forecast_udf_gen function

kronos.forecast_udf.forecast_udf_gen(client: mlflow.tracking.client.MlflowClient, key_col: str, date_col: str, metric_col: str, fcst_col: str, quality_col: str, action_col: str, models_col: str, models_config: str, days_from_last_obs_col: str, current_date: datetime.date, fcst_first_date: datetime.date, n_test: int, n_unit_test: int, fcst_horizon: int, dt_creation_col: str, dt_reference_col: str)

A function used to create a pandas User Defined Function (UDF) with the specified parameters.

Parameters

  • client (MlflowClient) – The mlflow client to use to track experiments and register models.

  • key_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the time series key.

  • date_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the time dimension.

  • metric_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the dimension to forecast.

  • fcst_col (str) – The name of the column indication the forecast.

  • quality_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the quality of time series (“bad” or “good”) which determines if a statistical or naive model should be trained.

  • action_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the action to take for the time series. This could be: * “competition”: One (or more) models are trained and put in competition with each other and with the one already in production. * “training”: Retraining the currently production model. * “predict”: Use the production model to predict.

  • models_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the models for competition.

  • models_config (str) – The string (in json format) containing all the model configurations.

  • days_from_last_obs_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the days since the last available observation in the time series.

  • current_date (datetime.date) – Current processing date.

  • fcst_first_date (datetime.date) – Date of first day of forecast, usually is the day following the current date.

  • n_test (int) – Number of observations to use as test set.

  • n_unit_test (int) – Number of points to forecast in the model deployment’s unit test.

  • fcst_horizon (int) – Number of points to forecast.

  • dt_creation_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the forecast creation date.

  • dt_reference_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the date used as reference date for forecast.

Returns

A pandas UDF with the specified parameters as arguments.

Example

forecast_udf = forecast_udf_gen(
        client=MlflowClient(),
        key_col='id',
        date_col='date',
        metric_col='y',
        fcst_col='y_hat',
        quality_col='quality',
        action_col='action',
        models_col='models',
        models_config='{"pmdarima_1":{"model_flavor":"pmdarima","m":7,"seasonal":true}}',
        days_from_last_obs_col='days_from_last_obs',
        current_date=(date.today() + timedelta(-1)).strftime('%Y-%m-%d'),
        fcst_first_date=date.today().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'),
        n_test=7,
        n_unit_test=7,
        fcst_horizon=7,
        dt_creation_col='creation_date',
        dt_reference_col='reference_date'
    )
